content:
• Wednesday, June 6, 2012
  • MOH

    Molina Healthcare (NYSE:MOH) withdraws its FY12 earnings guidance, citing in an SEC disclosure...

    Molina Healthcare (NYSE:MOH) withdraws its FY12 earnings guidance, citing in an SEC disclosure the uncertainty as to whether its STAR+PLUS premium revenue will be sufficient to cover Medicaid costs in Texas. Shares -12.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:04 PM
  • SEAC

    More on SeaChange International (NASDAQ:SEAC): Q1 misses across the board as wider losses due to...

    More on SeaChange International (NASDAQ:SEAC): Q1 misses across the board as wider losses due to lower revenue and costs from discontinued operations weigh on bottom line results. The company also lowers Q2 revenue estimates, now expecting to earn between $35M - $37M. Street estimates were at $40M in revenue. Shares -5.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM
  • DDC

    Harry Winston Diamond (HWD): Q1 EPS of $0.14 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $192.5M (+33.8% Y/Y)...

    Harry Winston Diamond (HWD): Q1 EPS of $0.14 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $192.5M (+33.8% Y/Y) beats by $49M. Shares -4.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM
  • TUES

    Closeout retailer Tuesday Morning (NASDAQ:TUES) warns it expects FY12 (ends in June) revenue of...

    Closeout retailer Tuesday Morning (NASDAQ:TUES) warns it expects FY12 (ends in June) revenue of $810M-$815M and EPS of $0.11-$0.15, below prior guidance of $828M-$834M and $0.22-$0.26. In response, the company is firing CEO Kathleen Mason and has begun a search for a permanent successor. Newly-appointed COO Michael Marchetti will serve as interim CEO. Shares are halted. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:23 PM
  • PLL-OLD

    Pall (NYSE:PLL-OLD): FQ3 EPS of $0.70 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $715.2M (+1% Y/Y) misses by...

    Pall (NYSE:PLL-OLD): FQ3 EPS of $0.70 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $715.2M (+1% Y/Y) misses by $10M. A slowdown in Europe is the story. Life Sciences sales to Europe -6.2% Y/Y. Industrial sales to Europe +0.5% Y/Y. At 7.5% of assets, the company is the 3rd largest holding in the Water Resources ETF (NASDAQ:PHO).  Shares -4.8% AH.  (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM
  • UHAL

    More on Amerco (NASDAQ:UHAL): Q1 beats solidly as a 7.2% rise in total revenue offset higher...

    More on Amerco (NASDAQ:UHAL): Q1 beats solidly as a 7.2% rise in total revenue offset higher expenses. Core moving and storage businesses were strong, with self-moving equipment rental revenue increasing $27M or 8% Y/Y, while the average occupied storage square footage rose over 10% during the same period. Shares +7.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM
  • GD

    General Dynamics (NYSE:GD) says Chairman and CEO Jay Johnson will retire effective Dec. 31, to...

    General Dynamics (NYSE:GD) says Chairman and CEO Jay Johnson will retire effective Dec. 31, to be replaced by COO Phebe Novakovic. GD -2.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM
  • CACI

    Government IT services firm CACI is up 3.6% AH after: a) guiding for FY13 revenue of $3.8B-$4B...

    Government IT services firm CACI is up 3.6% AH after: a) guiding for FY13 revenue of $3.8B-$4B and EPS of $6.60-$6.90, which compares with a consensus of $3.87B and $5.79; b) announcing a 4M share stock buyback program (good for buying 15% of outstanding shares); c) announcing CEO Paul Cofoni plans to retire as of Dec. 1, and will be replaced as CEO by U.S. operations chief Daniel Allen on July 1. Other than that, it's business as usual.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • TLRD

    More on Mens Wearhouse (MW): Q1 misses on both EPS and revenue due to stagnant sales. Retail...

    More on Mens Wearhouse (MW): Q1 misses on both EPS and revenue due to stagnant sales. Retail segment sales were weak, increasing just 3.1% versus the prior year, while corporate apparel sales dropped over 16% during the same period, primarily due to later launch dates for customer new uniform programs. The company also guides FY12 EPS expectations lower, now anticipating earnings in a range of $2.70 to $2.78 per share. Street estimates are for an EPS of $2.85. Shares -19.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • ALOG

    Analogic (NASDAQ:ALOG): FQ3 EPS of $0.76 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $121.3M (+3.5% Y/Y) misses...

    Analogic (NASDAQ:ALOG): FQ3 EPS of $0.76 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $121.3M (+3.5% Y/Y) misses by $7M. Shares -1.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • ACHN

    Achillion Pharmaceuticals (ACHN)  announces the resignation of its Senior VP of Clinical...

    Achillion Pharmaceuticals (ACHN)  announces the resignation of its Senior VP of Clinical Development and Chief Medical Officer, Elizabeth Olek, effective June 18. Milind Deshpande, Ph.D., President of R&D and Chief Scientific Officer, will assume oversight of all ongoing and planned clinical trials. The resignation comes at a key time as the company moves into important clinical trials for its protease inhibitor, ACH-1625, and second-generation NS5A inhibitor, ACH-3102, later this year. Shares -4.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • VRNT

    Verint Systems (NASDAQ:VRNT): Q1 EPS of $0.53 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $196.6M (+12% Y/Y)...

    Verint Systems (NASDAQ:VRNT): Q1 EPS of $0.53 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $196.6M (+12% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -1.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • SEAC

    SeaChange International (NASDAQ:SEAC): Q1 EPS of $0.06 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $36.6M (-10%...

    SeaChange International (NASDAQ:SEAC): Q1 EPS of $0.06 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $36.6M (-10% Y/Y) misses by $8M. Shares -6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • DGIT

    Ad distribution network owner Digital Generation (DGIT +26.5%) soared in the final minutes of...

    Ad distribution network owner Digital Generation (DGIT +26.5%) soared in the final minutes of trading thanks to a Bloomberg report claiming the company, which still only closed at $12.13, turned down a $20+/share buyout offer from privately-owned ExtremeReach-Providence. Shares are down 7.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • TLRD

    Men's Wearhouse (MW): Q1 EPS of $0.53 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $536.7M (+1.1% Y/Y) misses by...

    Men's Wearhouse (MW): Q1 EPS of $0.53 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $536.7M (+1.1% Y/Y) misses by $56M. Shares -23% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMED

    Shares of Amedisys (AMED +6%) finish higher after making a compelling case about the long-term...

    Shares of Amedisys (AMED +6%) finish higher after making a compelling case about the long-term potential for the home-nursing sector at Jefferies' Global Healthcare Conference yesterday. The key takeaway was that managed-care prospects are good and should be an increasingly greater driver of growth for the company. One caveat however, the company acknowledged a lack of visibility regarding Medicare reimbursement over the near-term. (webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • MDW

    Stifel Nicolaus initiates Midway Gold (MDW -2%) at Buy, foreseeing production of 150K-200K...

    Stifel Nicolaus initiates Midway Gold (MDW -2%) at Buy, foreseeing production of 150K-200K ounces annually with strong cash flow while retaining a prospective exploration upside. "In an environment where capital and operating cost inflation has marginalized large development projects, MDW's assets generally represent a portfolio of high return, technically simple, compact projects."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • TUES

    Tuesday Morning's (TUES +8.6%) shares jump after Becker Drapkin Management discloses a 5.02%...

    Tuesday Morning's (TUES +8.6%) shares jump after Becker Drapkin Management discloses a 5.02% stake in the home-furnishing close-out retailer, and an activist investment firm says it intends to seek board representation as it criticizes the company's performance and leadership.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • POL

    PolyOne (POL +4.3%) is started with a Buy rating at Gabelli, which says the polymer materials...

    PolyOne (POL +4.3%) is started with a Buy rating at Gabelli, which says the polymer materials and services provider is well positioned to benefit from its ability to serve customers globally, a focus on the higher margin specialty platform and the acquisition of ColorMatrix. Also, Longbow Research hikes its rating on POL to Buy while cutting peer A. Schulman (SHLM -5.7%) to Sell.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • SHPG

    Shire (SHPGY +2.4%) gains on an upgrade to Positive on valuation at Susquehanna, citing better...

    Shire (SHPGY +2.4%) gains on an upgrade to Positive on valuation at Susquehanna, citing better earnings visibility.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • ISRG

    Intuitive Surgical (ISRG +2.2%) should be bought , albeit selectively, says William Blair. The...

    Intuitive Surgical (ISRG +2.2%) should be bought , albeit selectively, says William Blair. The firm recommends using the recent weakness to pick it up. Its channel checks indicate the outlook for robotic surgery has never been stronger, however Zytiga drug approval is likely years away. The firm maintains an Outperform rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • BRCD

    Brocade (BRCD +7.5%) surges after it's disclosed CEO Michael Klayko bought $219.7K worth of...

    Brocade (BRCD +7.5%) surges after it's disclosed CEO Michael Klayko bought $219.7K worth of shares at an average price of $4.39. Klayko just became Brocade's interim sales chief, following the resignation of Ian Whiting.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM
  • GLD

    Gold tumbles after relative optimism from the Beige Book cools thoughts of additional Fed...

    Gold tumbles after relative optimism from the Beige Book cools thoughts of additional Fed action. GLD flat after being higher by nearly 1% before the report.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM | 7 Comments
  • HES

    BofA Merrill Lynch lowers its oil price forecast but says the selloff in oil stocks has opened...

    BofA Merrill Lynch lowers its oil price forecast but says the selloff in oil stocks has opened up attractive opportunities, viewing top pick Hess (HES +4.6%) and others - MRO +3.7%, CHK +5.3%, APC +4.8%, OXY +3.7% - as offering the best upside potential. Many of the downside risks facing those companies are already priced into the stocks, the firm says. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • TSLA

    Barclays maintains its Overweight rating on Tesla Motors (TSLA +2.4%) a day after the official...

    Barclays maintains its Overweight rating on Tesla Motors (TSLA +2.4%) a day after the official release of the Model S sedan. Analysts are warming up to the stock after the company launched the new EV ahead of schedule and passed the EPA certification process.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • MSFT

    LinkedIn (LNKD -0.7%) underperforms following a report that passwords for 6.5M of its 161M+...

    LinkedIn (LNKD -0.7%) underperforms following a report that passwords for 6.5M of its 161M+ accounts had been stolen. A U.K. security company more or less confirms that a breach occurred, and recommends users change their passwords. LinkedIn says it's investigating the issue.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • HAL

    Oil service stocks (OIH +1.7%) hold up well despite Halliburton's (HAL -2.4%) operational...

    Oil service stocks (OIH +1.7%) hold up well despite Halliburton's (HAL -2.4%) operational update, which said the price of guar gum "has inflated more rapidly than previously expected due to concerns over the potential for shortages for the commodity later in 2012." It seems unlikely HAL would be the only firm in the sector with tight supplies, Jon Ogg notes. BHI -0.9% but SLB +2.6%, WFT +0.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • HAL

    Halliburton (NYSE:HAL) trading resumes in a whipsaw pattern. Shares initially opened -$0.21 then...

    Halliburton (NYSE:HAL) trading resumes in a whipsaw pattern. Shares initially opened -$0.21 then quickly bounced back, trading +$0.23 on the day only to fade once again back into the red.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • HAL

    More on Halliburton (HAL -0.3%): Lowers its forecast for North America margins in its...

    More on Halliburton (HAL -0.3%): Lowers its forecast for North America margins in its operational update, citing higher costs for guar gum as a result of its expansion of oil and liquids-related activity in North America. Guar gum is an agricultural commodity used as a blending additive to its fluids utilized in hydraulic fracturing. Margins are expected to be impacted by an additional 300 basis points more than previous guidance of 200-250 basis points.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM | 6 Comments
  • GRPN

    More on Stifel's Groupon (GRPN +7.4%) upgrade: Analyst Jordan Rohan thinks shares now fully...

    More on Stifel's Groupon (GRPN +7.4%) upgrade: Analyst Jordan Rohan thinks shares now fully price in the company's restatement and lockup expiration, and expects more efficient marketing spending to drive operating leverage. He adds estimates could be too low if Groupon moves into traditional e-commerce, as he expects (ed: that would expand Groupon's market, but also brings capex, inventory, and channel conflict risks, not to mention direct competition with AMZN).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM
  • HAL

    Trading has been halted in Halliburton (HAL +1.9%) with news pending.

    Trading has been halted in Halliburton (HAL +1.9%) with news pending.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • AGNC

    Among the stocks making new 52-week highs today are two mortgage REITs, the sector proving...

    Among the stocks making new 52-week highs today are two mortgage REITs, the sector proving itself on both risk-on and risk-off days as short rates look to be anchored near zero for pretty much forever. American Capital Agency (NASDAQ:AGNC) is up 17% YTD while yielding 15.2%, and CYS Investments is up 6.9% YTD while yielding 14.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM | 3 Comments
  • OXM

    Oxford Industries (OXM +9.01%) pops after posting a decent Q1 earnings report late yesterday....

    Oxford Industries (OXM +9.01%) pops after posting a decent Q1 earnings report late yesterday. Total revenue actually jumped 11% Y/Y, but was masked by higher costs which hit margins and flattened net profit. Net sales also increased 11% to $231M. The apparel company raised its FY12 EPS outlook, now expecting to earn between $2.85 - $2.95 per share. Street estimates are for $2.76 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM
  • NDZ

    Nordion (NDZ -7.2%) slides after its FQ2 missed Street expectations across the board. Revenue...

    Nordion (NDZ -7.2%) slides after its FQ2 missed Street expectations across the board. Revenue slipped across all of the medical-science company's main business segments, as special items weighed on Y/Y results.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • MIND

    Mitcham Industries (MIND -6.7%) takes a hit after its FQ1 misses on both counts. Net earnings...

    Mitcham Industries (MIND -6.7%) takes a hit after its FQ1 misses on both counts. Net earnings actually rose 39% on higher equipment-leasing revenue, but gross margins sank to 48.8% from 52.5%, primarily due to higher depreciation expenses.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • KGC

    Kinross Gold (KGC +2.1%) says workers at its Tasiast gold mine in Mauritania in West Africa have...

    Kinross Gold (KGC +2.1%) says workers at its Tasiast gold mine in Mauritania in West Africa have initiated an unlawful work stoppage, halting mining and processing activity at the operation. The mine produced 200K gold equivalent ounces in 2011, but output is expected to ramp up over the next few years.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM
  • FSLR

    As investors pile into risk assets, First Solar (FSLR +7.7%) is leading a rally in solar stocks...

    As investors pile into risk assets, First Solar (FSLR +7.7%) is leading a rally in solar stocks (TAN +3.4%). Shares had fallen 89% over the prior 12 months as of yesterday's close. The rally comes even as the head of a French trade association warns solar vendors hold a year's worth of inventory, raising the prospect of widespread bankruptcies and consolidation. He adds panel demand might grow 18% in 2012 to 32GW, growth that will be more than offset by price declines. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM
  • PVG

    Pretium Resources (PVG +9.6%) shares soar after the miner reports continued high-grade results...

    Pretium Resources (PVG +9.6%) shares soar after the miner reports continued high-grade results from its Valley of the Kings drilling and include a "significant" number of assays grading over 1,000 grams/ton of gold. A total 26,230 meters of drilling in 60 holes has been completed in the first phase of its Brucejack Exploration Program.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM
  • KOG

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG +9.1%) is among the day's top energy gainers after shares are...

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG +9.1%) is among the day's top energy gainers after shares are upgraded - along with CRK +9.1%, ROSE +6% and NBL +2.9% - to Add from Neutral at CapitalOne Southcoast. As for KOG, "successful remediation efforts in the future for other previously damaged wells could help to correct some of what led to production shortfalls over the last two quarters."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • SVNTQ

    Savient Pharmaceuticals (SVNT +4.4%) says new data presented at the European League Against...

    Savient Pharmaceuticals (SVNT +4.4%) says new data presented at the European League Against Rheumatism congress showed patients with refractory chronic gout also suffering from chronic kidney disease responded to treatment with its drug Krystexxa regardless of its baseline chronic kidney disease stage. The company is seeking approval for Krystexxa in Europe.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • AKAM

    Akamai (AKAM +3.6%) and Limelight (LLNW +3.4%) bounce a little a day after getting clocked on...

    Akamai (AKAM +3.6%) and Limelight (LLNW +3.4%) bounce a little a day after getting clocked on news of Netflix's (NASDAQ:NFLX) plans to build a content delivery network (CDN). Akamai, which received only 1% of its 2011 revenue from Netflix, notes Netflix will need to make large investments in both software and infrastructure to produce an effective CDN. Dan Rayburn argues Netflix's move is actually a positive for Limelight and Level 3 (NASDAQ:LVLT), given the low margins attached to Netflix sales. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • MNI

    Warren Buffett's affinity for newspaper companies - on full display with an investment in Lee...

    Warren Buffett's affinity for newspaper companies - on full display with an investment in Lee Enterprises announced in a SEC filing - is helping lift up other names in the old-school publishing sector. Advancers: MNI +8.8%, JRN +3.8%, GCI +2.5%, AHC +2.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • LPI

    Laredo Petroleum (LPI +4.9%) increases its 2012 production guidance to +35% Y/Y and revises its...

    Laredo Petroleum (LPI +4.9%) increases its 2012 production guidance to +35% Y/Y and revises its capital budget to ~$900M. Total production is now expected at 11.2M-11.9M boe, a 35% increase from 2011 and 25% higher than LPI's initial guidance. Projected capex is raised $140M from its previously announced budget.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • TPX

    Analysts at both KeyBank and Suntrust move off their Buy ratings on Tempur-Pedic (TPX -46.7%)...

    Analysts at both KeyBank and Suntrust move off their Buy ratings on Tempur-Pedic (TPX -46.7%) after admitting they were blindsided by the company's guidance bombshell. To give credit where credit is due, last week channel checks by Barclays tipped off that a problem could be in the making.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM | 1 Comment
  • MNK

    Speaking at the Jefferies 2012 Global Healthcare Conference in New York, Questcor...

    Speaking at the Jefferies 2012 Global Healthcare Conference in New York, Questcor Pharmaceuticals' (QCOR +7.5%) says its only product, Acthar, remains strong, and the company is poised for solid Q2 sales numbers. Scripts figures for the drug are up on a M/M basis for treating patients with both multiple sclerosis and nephrotic syndrome. (presentation)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • NUVA

    NuVasive (NUVA +5.6%) gets a pop from an upgrade to Outperform at RBC Capital. The firm says...

    NuVasive (NUVA +5.6%) gets a pop from an upgrade to Outperform at RBC Capital. The firm says that the results of a recent survey of U.S. spine surgeons show the Street may be underestimating the near-term sustainability of the medical device company's U.S. lumbar revenue growth rate.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • SLV

    Gold is moving nicely higher, +1.3% to $1,639/oz. as the Fed starts to stir, but the big action...

    Gold is moving nicely higher, +1.3% to $1,639/oz. as the Fed starts to stir, but the big action is in silver, +4.6%, and erasing all of May's losses in June's first few days.  SLV +4.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • HES

    Hess (HES +4.3%) surges as the oil and gas producer is named a top pick at BofA, which notes the...

    Hess (HES +4.3%) surges as the oil and gas producer is named a top pick at BofA, which notes the stock has dropped to within 10% of its 2008 low. "Regardless of the European concerns, this is unwarranted," the firm says. Tudor Pickering also upgrades Hess as well as Occidental (OXY +2.7%) and Concho (CXO +3.7%) to Buy, while cutting Goodrich (NYSE:GR) to Hold.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • AGCO

    Agco (AGCO +3.5%) is considering paying a regular dividend or buying back shares, CFO Andy Beck...

    Agco (AGCO +3.5%) is considering paying a regular dividend or buying back shares, CFO Andy Beck said yesterday, adding that the farm-equipment maker would hold internal discussions in H2. Like its rivals, Agco has been benefiting from strong demand, although its shares have fallen further than its peers this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • MNTX

    Manitex International (MNTX +4.4%) jumps after saying it's received $6.2M in new orders for CVS...

    Manitex International (MNTX +4.4%) jumps after saying it's received $6.2M in new orders for CVS and Badger Equipment products. Delivery is scheduled for H212 and H113.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • WCC

    WESCO International (WCC +2.2%) gains after saying it's appointed Kenneth S. Parks as the...

    WESCO International (WCC +2.2%) gains after saying it's appointed Kenneth S. Parks as the company's new CFO, effective June 6.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • SHAW

    Shaw Group (SHAW +5.1%) plans to acquire up to 50% of NET Power LLC as part of a plan to build a...

    Shaw Group (SHAW +5.1%) plans to acquire up to 50% of NET Power LLC as part of a plan to build a new type of natural gas-fired power plant. Plans call for construction and commissioning by 2014 of a 25 MW nat gas plant that will capture all emissions and generate revenue from the sale of electricity and CO2 for enhanced oil recovery.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • RYL

    Credit Suisse upgrades homebuilders Ryland (RYL +3.8% to $21.17) and Pulte (PHM +6.5% to $8.69)...

    Credit Suisse upgrades homebuilders Ryland (RYL +3.8% to $21.17) and Pulte (PHM +6.5% to $8.69) to outperform from neutral, and raises Ryland's price target to $23.50 from $20 while keeping Pulte's at $11. CS cited a positive survey of real-estate agents and predicted a return to profitability as early as Q2.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • KMI

    Goldman Sachs and Carlyle Group are cashing out big chunks of their stakes in Kinder Morgan (KMI...

    Goldman Sachs and Carlyle Group are cashing out big chunks of their stakes in Kinder Morgan (KMI -2.8%) in the upcoming secondary offering: Goldman is selling 36.7M of its 134.8M shares, while Carlyle is selling 12.7M of its 51.2M. Goldman's KMI stake drew criticism during the El Paso purchase, as the longtime EP banker continued to do work for the target despite a substantial investment in KMI.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • KKD

    A number of coffee stocks are perking up in early trading, with Krispy Kreme (KKD +5.6%), Green...

    A number of coffee stocks are perking up in early trading, with Krispy Kreme (KKD +5.6%), Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +4.4%), and Coffee Holdings (JVA +2.5%) all posting gains. Analysts have stoked the M&A fire in the sector a bit, while themes of global growth prospects and lower wholesale coffee prices also hold sway.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM

  • Fifth & Pacific (FNP +2.5%) plans to exercise an option to acquire a 51% interest in Kate Spade...

    Fifth & Pacific (FNP +2.5%) plans to exercise an option to acquire a 51% interest in Kate Spade Japan held by Sanei International after it completed a round of debt financing.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN +7.8%) jumps on an upgrade to Hold from Stifel, which downgraded the company in...

    Groupon (GRPN +7.8%) jumps on an upgrade to Hold from Stifel, which downgraded the company in April following its Q4 restatement. Shares are up 18% over the last two days after making new post-IPO lows on Monday. (yesterday)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • DNR

    Denbury Resources (DNR +3.1%) raises its production estimate for 2012 after closing on a $360M...

    Denbury Resources (DNR +3.1%) raises its production estimate for 2012 after closing on a $360M acquisition of a Texas oil field. DNR's new estimate for the year is in the range of 69,775 to 74,775 boe/day, an increase of 1,150 boe/day from its previous forecast.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • P

    Pandora (P +3.8%) rallies after posting its May audience metrics. Listener hours totaled 1.1B,...

    Pandora (P +3.8%) rallies after posting its May audience metrics. Listener hours totaled 1.1B, +4% M/M and+87% Y/Y (April's growth was also 87%). The company's share of U.S. radio listening was 5.80%, up from 3.08% a year ago and down from 5.95% in April (there was a smaller decline from April to May last year). Active listeners stood at 53.3M at month's end, +3% M/M and +52% Y/Y. Pandora has also struck a distribution deal with Mazda. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM | 1 Comment
  • ULTA

    Ulta Salon (ULTA +6.1%) trades higher on strong volume after beating Q1 earnings estimates and...

    Ulta Salon (ULTA +6.1%) trades higher on strong volume after beating Q1 earnings estimates and upping its guidance. CEO Chuck Rubin points to increased online business and new products as revenue drivers.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK +3.7%) pops at the open on reports of advanced talks to sell CHK's...

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK +3.7%) pops at the open on reports of advanced talks to sell CHK's interests in Chesapeake Midstream Partners (CHKM +5.5%) and other pipeline assets.
